channel.title: Saved the osprey now what?
channel.description:
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=788423385[/url] [img]https://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/395581850110381402/5508FE407BDBA2239754D102043CA79921E0C1FE/[/img] [img]https://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/395581850110383928/231C63A2FC93BF803205A50F4CF0B89904CB6976/[/img]
This thing should really have a take off animation if you manage to save it, or the crew comming in inadvertently causing it to explode.
concept: osprey saved
[osprey name]: "Our ground support is KIA, [reinforcement name] where are you, these things might be back any second now."
*door blows open.
[support]: "[osprey] you need to take off now, we will cover you or exvil"
*copter starts to take off, soldiers notice player, gun fight ensues.

item.title: Saved the osprey now what?
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Maybe they can do the thing they did for the scientists that die in multiple ways depending on how fast the player reacts (like the one that can run into a tripmine instead being gunned down by a turret, etc.). Only for the osprey, it tries to take off and gets manta ray-ed.

Read full topic

item.title: Saved the osprey now what?
item.dc:creator: darkone
item.description:
managed to do this a second time recently. still nothing happens. damn it is hard to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Saved the osprey now what?
item.dc:creator: RedEye
item.description:
Or just make it so the osprey can’t be saved. They are not known as the “Carolina Lawn Dart” for nothing. IRL they are flyingcoffins.
The V-22 Osprey had 7 hull-loss accidents with a total of 36 fatalities. During testing from 1991 to 2000 there were four crashes resulting in 30 fatalities. Since becoming operational in 2007, the V-22 has had three crashes resulting in six fatalities including one combat-zone crash, and several minor incidents.

Read full topic
